author: @WITN
title: Domestic dispute call in Washington County leads to drug and gun charges
text:
Domestic dispute call in Washington County leads to drug and gun charges
WASHINGTON COUNTY, N.C. (WITN) - A call for a domestic dispute leads to drug and gun charges against a Plymouth man.
Deputies in Washington County say they went to a domestic violence call at 119 Locust Lane in Plymouth on Tuesday morning.
Deputies say 43-year-old Tony Webb was arrested after an alleged domestic situation involving his son and a gun.
According to deputies, Webb had two outstanding warrants out of Martin County for possession of a firearm by a felon and identity theft.
After a search of the home, deputies say they found over 2 lbs. of marijuana, 1 gram of crack cocaine, scales, packaging materials, a stolen 9mm Glock handgun and a .40 caliber Ruger handgun.
He was taken to the Washington County Sheriffâ€™s Office and put under a $250,000 secured bond.
